title: Tyson Fury finally speaks out on claims he took padding out of gloves in sparring
text:
Fury’s old sparring partner Nicholas Asberry made the glove-tampering claim (Picture: Getty)

Tyson Fury has totally dismissed the suggestion that he has ever taken padding out of his gloves during sparring after Nicholas Asberry made the astonishing claim.

The 29-year-old American, who was Fury’s sparring partner before his fight with Deontay Wilder last year, uploaded a video claiming to show the Gypsy King’s gloves after their session.

‘This is Tyson’s s*** and these are the sparring gloves we’ve been sparring with,’ said Asberry. ‘You can see there’s no f****** padding in here. All the padding is in the back of his f****** glove. Look at that s***.

👁️Tyson Fury's sparring partner Nicholas Asberry claims Fury removes padding from his gloves to hurt sparring partners. Shows Tyson alleged non padded gloves. #boxing #boxeo pic.twitter.com/4ndhoikygY — The Koncrete Jungle (@TheKJungle) October 19, 2019

‘I could touch the other side of my finger. There’s s*** falling out from the middle of the glove.’

Fury’s trainer, Ben Davison, as well as cutman Jorge Capetillo, have denied the claims and now the lineal champion himself has spoken out, rubbishing Asberry’s allegations.

‘I’ve not seen any videos so I don’t know what everyone’s going on about, but I’ve heard something about gloves, that I’ve taken padding out of gloves,’ Fury told IFL TV.

‘For who? For Nicholas Asberry?! Please! Have a day off will you! Have a day off and have two off please on Sundays.

‘So you think me at 30 fights, unbeaten for 11 years or whatever, is going to take some padding out of gloves to punch up a sparring partner who’s a bum anyway? Very unlikely.’

Asberry doubled down on his accusation in an interview with World Boxing News, saying: ‘I contacted them and they told me they would compensate me after the Wilder fight. They tried to talk me down and say they didn’t do anything to the gloves.

Fury sparred with Asberry before his fight with Deontay Wilder last December (Picture: Getty)

‘So, let’s say the possibility is that they didn’t. But as soon as I picked up the glove the inside was falling out. You could manipulate the part of the glove that makes contact with its target.

‘I showed in my screenshot conversations that they knew Tyson was sparring with gloves that were, to their account “dodgy”. The gloves just didn’t have all of the paddings in there. They also had weird marks on the outside of the glove that showed it was in contact with something other than what it was made for.’
description: Tyson Fury has dismissed the suggestion he took padding out of his gloves during sparring after Nicholas Asberry made the astonishing claim.
